title: Out Can Be In – Mobility in Ohrid
description: A mobility in Ohrid with workshops and activities for people with autism, including practical exercises, dance, and music.
fullDescription:
From 25.06.2024 to 28.06.2024, the team from North Macedonia participated in a mobility in Ohrid as part of the “Out Can Be In” project. On the first day, workshops were held at the high school “Sv. Kliment Ohridski,” including a presentation of the organization, a lecture on autism by Dr. Aleksandar Krajcheski, practical exercises, and discussions about autism in Macedonia, France, and Turkey. The day concluded with a walk through the old town of Ohrid.

On the second day, the team visited the kindergarten “Radost” for children with disabilities, where a dance workshop was led by Daniel Naumovski, and individual work with a child with autism was demonstrated by Aleksandra Sabras-Apostolova.

The third day focused on the center “Vo Mojot Svet,” where special educator Angela Chingoska guided the team through the rooms and explained the methods of work. The team interacted with children through dance and songs. The day ended with free time and a visit to the Wine Festival.

On the final day, the group visited Pirustija Nedanoski in Ramne, enjoying traditional Macedonian food, discussing the outcomes of the mobility, and carrying out dissemination activities for the project.
objectives: Enhance knowledge and skills for working with people with autism
Exchange experiences and best practices with international partners
Apply creative methods (dance, music, practical exercises) in education
results: Improved understanding of individualized approaches and techniques for working with autistic children
Implemented practical activities to develop motor and social skills
Strengthened local and international collaboration among partners
